owasp_top20_rules.name: SQL Injection
owasp_top20_rules.description: Untrusted input used to construct SQL queries can lead to data theft or corruption.
owasp_top20_rules.fix: Use parameterized queries or prepared statements.

owasp_top20_rules.name: Cross Site Scripting (XSS)
owasp_top20_rules.description: Improper handling of untrusted input allows injection of malicious scripts.
owasp_top20_rules.fix: Use output encoding and validate all input.

owasp_top20_rules.name: Information Leakage
owasp_top20_rules.description: Error messages reveal sensitive system or debug information.
owasp_top20_rules.fix: Sanitize and handle all exceptions securely.

owasp_top20_rules.name: Frame Injection
owasp_top20_rules.description: Attackers inject frames to trick users and capture data.
owasp_top20_rules.fix: Use frame-busting code and validate URLs.

owasp_top20_rules.name: Unvalidated URL Redirection
owasp_top20_rules.description: Improper validation of redirect URLs allows phishing redirects.
owasp_top20_rules.fix: Implement a whitelist of allowed domains.

owasp_top20_rules.name: Missing Session Timeout
owasp_top20_rules.description: Lack of session timeout enables unauthorized access after inactivity.
owasp_top20_rules.fix: Set appropriate session timeout limits.

owasp_top20_rules.name: Sensitive Info in GET URL
owasp_top20_rules.description: Sensitive data exposed in URL query parameters.
owasp_top20_rules.fix: Use POST instead of GET for sensitive information.

owasp_top20_rules.name: Session ID Cookies Not Secure
owasp_top20_rules.description: Session cookies transmitted over HTTP can be intercepted.
owasp_top20_rules.fix: Set secure flag on session cookies.

owasp_top20_rules.name: Cross Frame Scripting (XFS)
owasp_top20_rules.description: Attackers exploit frames to inject malicious scripts.
owasp_top20_rules.fix: Use proper validation and frame-busting techniques.

owasp_top20_rules.name: Sensitive Info Displayed as Clear Text
owasp_top20_rules.description: Sensitive data like passwords or tokens are displayed as plain text.
owasp_top20_rules.fix: Mask sensitive fields using password input types.

owasp_top20_rules.name: Sensitive Info Cached
owasp_top20_rules.description: Browser caching exposes confidential data.
owasp_top20_rules.fix: Use no-cache HTTP headers.

owasp_top20_rules.name: Inadequate Encryption Strength
owasp_top20_rules.description: Weak or outdated encryption algorithms can be brute-forced.
owasp_top20_rules.fix: Use strong encryption algorithms (AES-256, RSA-2048+).

owasp_top20_rules.name: CRLF Injection
owasp_top20_rules.description: User input in headers or logs can inject newlines.
owasp_top20_rules.fix: URL-encode user input and validate newlines.

owasp_top20_rules.name: Trust Boundary Violation
owasp_top20_rules.description: Untrusted input is mixed with trusted system data.
owasp_top20_rules.fix: Always validate input before trusting or storing.

owasp_top20_rules.name: Directory Traversal
owasp_top20_rules.description: User input allows access to arbitrary files on server.
owasp_top20_rules.fix: Restrict file access to safe directories only.

owasp_top20_rules.name: Session Fixation
owasp_top20_rules.description: Old session IDs are reused after login, enabling hijacking.
owasp_top20_rules.fix: Invalidate old sessions and issue new ones after login.

owasp_top20_rules.name: Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
owasp_top20_rules.description: Deprecated algorithms like MD5 or SHA1 reduce data integrity.
owasp_top20_rules.fix: Use SHA-256 or better for hashing.

owasp_top20_rules.name: Credentials Management
owasp_top20_rules.description: Passwords or secrets stored in plain text.
owasp_top20_rules.fix: Use secure password hashing (bcrypt, Argon2).

owasp_top20_rules.name: SQL Injection (Hibernate)
owasp_top20_rules.description: Dynamic SQL queries in ORM frameworks can be exploited.
owasp_top20_rules.fix: Use parameterized queries in ORM APIs.

owasp_top20_rules.name: Improper Resource Shutdown
owasp_top20_rules.description: Resources not released properly, leading to memory leaks or DoS.
owasp_top20_rules.fix: Always close files, connections, and streams.
